item.title: Find The Bay Guy
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: “Well, now I’ll have an answer,” Irv said, with a self-satisfied nod that resembled davening or Parkinson’s.

item.title: Here We Aren't So Quickly
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: We’ve owned this house for—what—twelve years now, I reckon.

item.title: Asleep in the Lord
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: Mitchell had never so much as changed a baby’s diaper before.

item.title: Extreme Solitude
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: It was debatable whether or not Madeleine had fallen in love with Leonard the first moment she’d seen him.

item.title: The Obscure Object
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: Short story about the narrator’s crush on her friend, the Object. The narrator, Calliope, realizes, throughout the course of the story, that

item.title: The Burning of Smyrna
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: Second of a two-part short story. The narrator continues the story of the marriage of his Greek grandparents, who are brother and sister.

item.title: The Speed of Sperm
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: I was born twice: once, as a baby girl, at 4.53 a.m. on a remarkably unpolluted Detroit day in 1960; and then again, as a teenage boy, in the offices of our family physician, Dr Arnold Philobosian, in 1976.
